reviews.text: The Hotel Drei Raben is a real gem. We stayed for a long weekend and the staff , service and breakfast were all excellent. This is a very cool hotel with attentive staff and great rooms .Theree is no fitness centre but plenty of jogging nearby. We also rented the Noris Bikes which the hotel helped with.
reviews.title: Fantastic Weekend

reviews.text: We only stayed one night and cannot wait to return! The small hotel is in the old part of Nürnberg and it has all amenities one needs. The staff are fabulous,, the rooms are fabulous, breakfast was delicious.
reviews.title: Fabulous boutique hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights May, 2012. Upon arrival, we were immediately upgraded from a junior suite to a top class 3 room suite. The room was very modern and had a stunning view of the town. The breakfast was good and you could have cook to order eggs. In the evening we had drinks in the bar. The bartender was very professional and knowledgeable. The wi-fi is free to guests, a real bonus.
reviews.title: Excellent service, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night and enjoyed my stay. I consider it a small boutique hotel; the front office staff were friendly and informal but very helpful with information and advice. The front office staff also doubled as service staff for breakfast. Enjoyed the breakfast because apart from the usual continental fare of bread, cold hams, they offered a choice of hot breakfast – eggs, pancakes etc.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is situated within walking distance of sights and shopping. Theme room was fun and cozy. Good Wi-Fi connect in the rooms too and best of all its free. Would stay again in future and for longer if possible.
reviews.title: Nowhere near as good as the Tripadvisor reviews indicate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel in July. After arriving to Nurnberg by train, we headed down the street to the hotel and found it easily. Upon check-in (which was efficient and easy) we were upgraded to the top floor suite! The hotel has an elevator which takes you up almost to the top, just a few flights and then we were at our room. The location of the hotel is great, close to all the things you want to see in Nurnberg (except for Zeppelin field which is an easy bus ride). The room, being at the top of the hotel was a bit stuffy and, it being July, also rather hot. In the room, there was a small air conditioner which we used, but it was not very powerful, so we were a bit warm, nothing a cool shower couldn't fix though. The room had a beautiful claw foot tub at the foot of the bed (a little strange for placement) but it was nice nonetheless. Small in-room tv, internet was slow and only available in certain parts of the room. One side of the bed was unlevel and super uncomfortable (I kept rolling to the middle of the bed where the beds meet), so I switched with my husband and it was fine. Nice view from the windows! It was also strange to have the sink in the main room area, so after using the washroom you needed to come out and wash your hands. I suppose this is the only configuration that would work given the space in the room.
reviews.title: Quirky Boutique Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: All staff spoke English very well, were polite and helpful. Breakfast was really good and included in OUR room rate. Vast array of goodies including soft boiled eggs! You can also order items from the menu (i.e.: German pancakes <crepes>, scrambled eggs, etc.) as well as have coffee, tea and cappuccino brought out to you. They have a cocktail hour in the evenings too. The bar area is a bit dark and is where breakfast is served daily.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all this hotel was nice. A few things were maybe a little too quirky for my taste but I really enjoyed my stay here!
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really good hotel, no question. We were greeted by the manager who came out to the street to direct us where to park the car. He then even helped us unload all our bags and brought them up to our room. The room was very good -- each is individually decorated, which adds to their charm. The breakfast in the morning was too notch as well, really tasty and plentiful. Location is fabulous -- easy walking distance to the main sights.
reviews.title: We recommend this very civilised yet quirky hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing I would recommend is not to take up the offer of valet parking -- was charged €15 for this when all they did was drive my car to the pay & display car park round the corner. The value of the parking was €3.40 and was about 2 mins from the hotel. A minor gripe, but worth knowing if I went again.
reviews.title: a good hotel -- but a bit weird...

reviews.text: In the pre-Trip Advisor era, the Drei Raben is the sort of place one might have been tempted to keep to one's self, something to tell special friends about. However the cat is out of the bag. On balance, this is probably the best all-around lodging we've experienced in recent memory.
reviews.title: Fully deserves its number one rating
Why put up with toast, if you can have this kind of bread?
reviews.text: Pros: large, spotless, stylish, quiet rooms situated perfectly in the old section of Nuremberg, which is a great walking-around city, near many interesting museums, landmarks and restaurants, and five minutes from the railway station; comfortable beds; an attentive, friendly, helpful and very professional staff; a great, varied breakfast buffet; free, fast Internet access.
Cons: zero.
reviews.title: Good location, good hotel.

reviews.text: My advice: book early, and if you can find a room, take it. You'll be delighted.
reviews.title: What a service

reviews.text: Nice place, modern and very near the beautifully rebuilt historical center of Nurnberg. As in many German hotels, the breakfast is marvellous. The choice of fine breads alone makes you wonder why some other countries put up with toast and eggs...
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel in January (two rooms - one for parents and one for kids) and chose it due to its good reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed! From the moment we arrived, the staff were very helpful, suggesting several places we could eat, giving directions and marking them on a map. The breakfast was excellent and the rooms were really comfortable, with a sense of fun. We had planned to just stay the one night but changed our arrangements so we could stay two. The town is a great size for exploring, and we loved the Polynesian Tiki bar/restaurant nearby.
reviews.title: Friendly staff made all the difference
Wonderful visit!
reviews.text: We had a wonderful experience at Hotel Drei Raben! The staff are all very friendly, attentive, and accommodating. Nice clean rooms. We kept our windows open as much as possible during the day, and always had a great breeze, and enjoyed the sounds of the bustle of the people below and the birds as well. Perfectly located for easy walking tours of the nearby historical sites....and across the street from amazing gingerbread cookies!
Stayed at the Drei Raben with my parents for the weekend- we had two separate rooms. My parents' room was upgraded and was really lovely. Mine was also nice.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, good breakast

reviews.text: The service was exceptional and we were made to feel welcome at all times; breakfast and the evening pre-dinner drinks were lovely.
reviews.title: Comfy, cute and convenient

reviews.text: The only objections I have to the hotel is that my room smelt a little fausty, that the smokers' smoke from the street level travel right into the bedrooms and that the surrouding area is incredibly noisy at the weekend, which makes sleeping difficult!
reviews.title: Nice Theme, Adequate Rooms
